revised_title: Circulation of Blood in Vermes and Its Distinction from Higher Classes of Animals
tldr: The author examines the unique circulation of blood in Vermes, a class of animals, and compares it to the higher classes of animals. The study reveals that the circulation in Vermes is reversed, with aerated blood going to the heart and then being propelled to the body's organs. This distinction highlights the essential purpose of the different circulatory systems in various animal classes.
